oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Rocky Hill School (abandoned)

oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Schools; Rural schools; Educational facilities
Education - Tennessee; Education - History - Tennessee; School buildings - Tennessee
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Front and side views of a clapboard building with steps to the front door. Exterior features include a steep pitched tin roof, four side windows, double door entrance and two chimneys.

This school was in a rural area north of the Lee Highway. It was abandoned and consolidated with Liberty which was nearer to Lee Highway and probably more accessible. Many schools were abandoned due to the consolidation that took place in the first decades of the twentieth century. The state was striving to improve the public school system throughout Tennessee.
